channel.title: Soundness and Completeness :: CIS 301 Textbook
channel.description: Soundness and completeness definitions We now revisit the notions of soundness and completeness. We recall from propositional logic that a proof system is sound if everything that is provable is actually true. A proof system is complete if everything that is true can be proved. Interpretations When we write statements in logic, we use predicates and function symbols (e.g., âˆ€ i (i * 2) > i). An interpretation gives the meaning of:
